text.text: How do I add a note to a transaction in the "Finish later" or review window?

text: To add a note to a transaction, you can click "Finish later" or "Review". This will add a note to the transaction and all associated claims after the transaction is successfully posted. You cannot add a note to a posted transaction.

text.text: What permission do I need to have to add a note to a transaction?

text: To add a note to a transaction, you need to have payment posting permission. Users with payment posting permission can edit a payment posting note made by another user on a transaction before it is posted.

text.text: What is the difference between adding a transaction note and adding a claim note?

text: The "Add Claim Note" option you see on the Payment Posting page, immediately adds a claim note to the claim for that line item. A transaction note, found when you click "Finish later", will add a note to the transaction and all the claims associated with that transaction after the transaction is successfully posted.

text.text: Can I add a note to a transaction that has already been posted?

text: You cannot add a note to a posted transaction. Transaction notes on all associated claims will be deleted if a transaction is reversed.

text.text: Is it possible to edit a transaction note after the transaction has been posted?

text: After posting the transaction, a note cannot be edited but can be removed. If it is removed, it is removed from all claims associated with the transaction. Deleting a transaction note will result in an audit entry.

text.text: How can I remove a transaction note after posting the transaction?

text: To remove a transaction note, you can delete the attachment after the batch is posted. This will remove it from all the claims within the transaction.

text.text: What happens if I delete a transaction note?

text: Deleting a transaction note will result in an audit entry. This functionality will not post a note to an ignored claim.

text.text: Will adding a transaction note affect ignored claims?

text: No, this functionality will not post a note to an ignored claim.

text.text: If I edit a transaction note on a claim, does it change the transaction note?

text: Editing a transaction note on a claim will not change the transaction note on the transaction or the other associated claims.

text.text: Who can edit a payment posting note made by another user on a transaction before posting?

text: Users with payment posting permission can edit a payment posting note made by another user on a transaction before it is posted. A user with payment posting permission, but not note permission, can edit or delete a payment posting note on a claim but can not edit or delete a non-payment posting note on the same claim.

text.text: What permissions are required to edit or delete a payment posting note on a claim?

text: A user with payment posting permission, but not note permission, can edit or delete a payment posting note on a claim but can not edit or delete a non-payment posting note on the same claim.

text.text: Can a user without note permission edit or delete a non-payment posting note on the same claim?

text: No, a user without note permission cannot edit or delete a non-payment posting note on the same claim.

text.text: Is there a restriction on the length or format of transaction notes?

text: There is a 2000 character limit on transaction notes.

text.text: How are transaction notes displayed within the system interface?

text: Transaction notes are displayed in the Finish later window.

text.text: Are transaction notes visible to all users with access to the transaction?

text: Transaction notes are visible to all users with access to the transaction.

text.text: Can I add multiple notes to the same transaction?

text: You can add multiple notes to the same transaction. Transaction notes are visible to all users with access to the transaction.

text.text: How can I differentiate between transaction notes and claim notes in the system?

text: The "Add Claim Note" option you see on the Payment Posting page immediately adds a claim note to the claim for that line item. A transaction note, found when you click "Finish later", will add a note to the transaction and all the claims associated with that transaction after the transaction is successfully posted.

text.text: Will transaction notes be included in audit logs?

text: Deleting a transaction note will result in an audit entry.

text.text: Can I search for transactions based on their associated notes?

text: You can use Advanced Search to find specific claims based on tags, exact claim balance, or claim in a certain profit center. You can also see all records in the system by leaving all the fields blank and clicking Search.

text.text: where can i add a transaction note?

text: You can add a transaction note in the "Finish later" or review window.

text.text: can  i edit payment posting note?

text: You can edit a payment posting note made by another user on a transaction before it is posted. You can also delete a payment posting note on a claim, but not a non-payment posting note.
